definition: to copy/to produce sth after a model/to counterfeit
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: Imitations can be made in France as well as in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 在法国我们可以象德国那样仿造这些饰物。

sentences.english: However, the Silver Shilling was abused as an imitation from that moment on.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，从那一刻起，银先令就被辱骂是仿造的。

sentences.english: Who in the world needs FAKE PLASTIC wishbones?
sentences.chinese: 世上谁会需要仿造的许愿骨头？

sentences.english: Links used to direct the gullible to a site selling counterfeits.
sentences.chinese: 一些链接会引导容易上当受骗的人去卖仿造品的网站。

sentences.english: You’d just get a good-enough me-too design.
sentences.chinese: 你只会得到一个刚刚好的仿造设计。

sentences.english: So when someone comes along with a pure copy of the product, we have to protect ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 所以要是有人仿造了我们的产品，我们必须自我保护。

sentences.english: China still suffers from its reputation of being a copycat manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 中国仍然受累于“山寨”仿造品制造者的声誉。

sentences.english: This model plane is modeled after a real plane.
sentences.chinese: 这个模型飞机仿造一架真飞机。

sentences.english: Two, he has sometimes copied Mr Wickfield's signature on to false documents and cheques.
sentences.chinese: 第二，他有时仿造威克菲尔的签字签写文件和支票。
中国是出了名的仿造大国。

sentences.english: Counterfeit marriage licenses and birth certificates began appearing on the black market.
sentences.chinese: 黑市开始出现仿造的结婚证和出生证。

sentences.english: He compared the imitation with the original.
sentences.chinese: 他比较了仿造品和原来的作品。

sentences.english: These copies are of very poor quality.
It is worthing seeing for the models of a wedding sedan and a real wedding bed in Yangliuqing.
sentences.chinese: 杨柳青值得一看的是仿造的结婚花轿和真正的婚床。

sentences.english: Patent product, the counterfeit must investigate.

definition: to copy/to imitate/to make by imitating a model
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to cast (pour metal into a mold)
